meanings.sent1: She guiled her friend into believing a tall tale.
meanings.sent2: The con artist guiled many people out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat guiled the dog into chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The shadows guiled the path, making it seem longer than it was.
meanings.sent5: His smooth words guiled her into thinking he was sincere.

meanings.definition: To use deception to achieve a goal
meanings.sent1: The spy guiled his way into the enemy's headquarters.
meanings.sent2: The magician guiled the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox guiled the farmer into leaving the henhouse unguarded.
meanings.sent4: Her smile guiled her enemies, hiding her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The politician guiled the voters with promises he had no intention of keeping.
